    Smart* API v2.0.4

    Scroll down for code samples, example requests and responses. Select a language for code samples from the tabs above or the mobile navigation menu.

    API Overview

    These are the API's upon which SmartEngage (with InteractAPI) and SmartCollect are built on. SmartCollect is an intelligent Customer payment management portal, designed for consumer collections, with integral digital messaging capabilities that can send and receive SMS and Email to drive customers to pay their bills. Additionally, customers can setup secure payment wallets, make promises to pay, set up payment plans, and complete Income and Expenditure derived affordability assessments. All this is governed by Client specific configuration and rules. SmartCollect is designed to work with data from Host systems. Typical Host systems are Collections, CRM, Billing systems. SmartCollect needs data for three main operations * to authenticate and contact the customer, * to understand the status and amount due on account, * understand any data required to apply rules or get rules on what payment options are available to each customer.

    Smart* provides Activity data on all Events that occur at a customer Account level. Activity data are all the events that happen in SmartCollect, sending any messages, delivery or not of that message, customers interacting with the portal, and payments made, successful or non-successful. By design, there are many events, and all events are recorded and available. To integrate with Smart*, there are API’s and Batch files interfaces, for both data input and data extraction . The batch files are JSON format, and the API’s are RESTful web services. A successful integration could be either API or Batch – and mix-and-match both the use of API’s and Batch. For Batch files, custom formats are available, and the effort to provide these custom formats would be dependent on how easily the JSON format can be converted to the Client required format. Practically, we run the JSON file through a format conversion process. The API’s are deployed as part of the Client install, and detailed API documentation is part of the Admin User interface. By design, there are frequent additions to this API in each release, however we will retain backward compatibility to all previously published API’s. SmartCollect is built as an Angular application, meaning that everything that is available in the Customer, Agent or Admin web portals is available as via the REST API. This means it is possible to integrate the UI into other portals.

    Batch Data Interfaces

    Batch interfaces is a common pragmatic method to integrate with Host systems. A one off “placement” file from the Host system is sent to initially populate SmartCollect with the population of customer data and to initiate messaging campaigns. Then at regular intervals an “update file” of changes in the customer data is provided by the Host system. The out-of-the-box format for these files is JSON.

    How to use this API to create an SMS payment system

    In order to start using the API you will need to have a User created on your deployment. This users needs to have the ROLES of XXXX XXX XXX. You can create the user from the Admin Interface.
    You also need to know your instance URL. This will be advised as part of your installation information. It is likely to be something like https://yourname.telrock.com/rest/v1

    Base URLs:

    • https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1

    Email: Telrock Support Web: Telrock Support

    Authentication

    • HTTP Authentication, scheme: basic The username/password information, to access the API.

    Authentication

    post__authentication

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "password": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /authentication

    Login

    Allows a User to log-in. A User is able to login to the Portal and use the API's, and can have number of Roles.

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "password": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » name body string false No description
    » password body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK, received and processed Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    delete__authentication

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication',
  method: 'delete',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication',
{
  method: 'DELETE',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.delete 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authentication", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /authentication

    Logout

    Performs clean-up actions on the server in order to dispose session's information. If you don't explicitly logout, the session will expire after non-activity according to your session timeout value. The default session time out is 30 minutes.

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    authenticateUser

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/authenticate", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /authenticate

    Authenticate a user

    Authenticate a user

    Body parameter

    {
  "username": "string",
  "password": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body AuthenticationRequest true The POST request, consisting of the instance of the authentication request

    Example responses

    {
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "password": "string",
  "groups": [
    "string"
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "accountLocked": true,
  "passwordLastUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "requirePasswordChange": true,
  "lastLogin": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. User
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Business Calendar

    get__businesscalendar_holiday

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday?component=string \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday?component=string HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday',
  method: 'get',
  data: '?component=string',
  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday?component=string',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.get 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday',
  params: {
  'component' => 'string'
}, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.get('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday', params={
  'component': 'string'
}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday?component=string");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/businesscalendar/holiday", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /businesscalendar/holiday

    Retrieve Public holidays

    Fetch defined public holidays, by component.

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: PublicHolidayVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    component query string true The 'business-unit' that this configuration belongs to.
    channel query string false Public holidays can be separated by message channel as well.
    from query string false The search start date (in milliseconds since 01-01-1970).
    to query string false The search end date (in milliseconds since 01-01-1970).

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getAllPublicHolidays

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();

    console.log(body);

HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;

    response.append(inputLine);

in.close();

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /calendar/holiday

    Get all public holidays

    Get all business calendar public holiday definitions

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "id": "423-dfgsd-35423-asdf-52q345",
      "component": "FRAUD_ALERT",
      "description": "Christmas Day",
      "channel": "SMS",
      "date": "2017-12-24"
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [PublicHoliday] false No description
    » Public holiday definition PublicHoliday false No description
    »» id string false The unique reference, for this PublicHoliday entry
    »» component string false The component, that this PublicHoliday applies to
    »» description string true A meaningful description of this PublicHoliday
    »» channel string false The message channel, that this PublicHoliday applies to
    »» date string(date) true The calendar date, of this PublicHoliday (full-date - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    channel SMS
    channel EMAIL
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    addPublicHoliday

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "channel": "SMS",
  "date": "2018-04-05"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /calendar/holiday

    Add a public holiday

    Add a new business calendar public holiday definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "channel": "SMS",
  "date": "2018-04-05"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body PublicHoliday true The new PublicHoliday definition

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getPublicHolidayById

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.get 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.get('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /calendar/holiday/{holidayId}

    Get public holiday by id

    Get a specific business calendar public holiday definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    holidayId path string true The PublicHoliday definitions's id

    Example responses

    {
  "value": {
    "id": "423-dfgsd-35423-asdf-52q345",
    "component": "FRAUD_ALERT",
    "description": "Christmas Day",
    "channel": "SMS",
    "date": "2017-12-24"
  }
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. PublicHoliday
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updatePublicHoliday

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "channel": "SMS",
  "date": "2018-04-05"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.put 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /calendar/holiday/{holidayId}

    Update public holiday

    Update a business calendar public holiday definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "channel": "SMS",
  "date": "2018-04-05"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    holidayId path string true The PublicHoliday definitions's id
    body body PublicHoliday true The updated PublicHoliday definition

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deletePublicHolidayById

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com


    
$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
  method: 'delete',

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
{
  method: 'DELETE'

})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

result = RestClient.delete 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}',
  params: {
  }

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}', params={

)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/holiday/{holidayId}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /calendar/holiday/{holidayId}

    Remove public holiday by id

    Remove a specific business calendar public holiday definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    holidayId path string true The PublicHoliday definitions's id

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getAllSendingWindows

    Code samples

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /calendar/window

    Get all sending windows

    Get all business calendar sending window definitions

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "id": "423-dfgsd-35423-asdf-52q345",
      "component": "FRAUD_ALERT",
      "start": "09:00",
      "end": "17:00",
      "day": 1,
      "allowed": true,
      "channel": "SMS"
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [SendingWindow] false No description
    » Daily Sending Window SendingWindow false No description
    »» id string false The unique reference, for this SendingWindow entry
    »» component string false The component, that this SendingWindow applies to
    »» channel string false The message channel, that this SendingWindow applies to
    »» start string true The window start time (time-hour ":" time-minute - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »» end string true The window end time (time-hour ":" time-minute - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »» day integer true The calendar day (Sunday=1, Monday=2, Tuesday=3, Wednesday=4, Thursday=5, Friday=6, Saturday=7)
    »» allowed boolean true Is sending permitted, at all, on this day (i.e. if set to false, then the SendingWindow for the entire day is closed)

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    channel SMS
    channel EMAIL
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    addSendingWindow

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "channel": "SMS",
  "start": "string",
  "end": "string",
  "day": 1,
  "allowed": true
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);

}, headers = headers)

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /calendar/window

    Add a sending window

    Add a new business calendar sending window definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "channel": "SMS",
  "start": "string",
  "end": "string",
  "day": 1,
  "allowed": true
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body SendingWindow true The new SendingWindow definition

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getSendingWindowById

    Code samples

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /calendar/window/{windowId}

    Get sending window by id

    Get a specific business calendar sending window definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": {
    "id": "423-dfgsd-35423-asdf-52q345",
    "component": "FRAUD_ALERT",
    "start": "09:00",
    "end": "17:00",
    "day": 1,
    "allowed": true,
    "channel": "SMS"
  }
}

    200 OK Operation is successful. SendingWindow
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None

  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window/{windowId}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window/{windowId}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window/{windowId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /calendar/window/{windowId}

    Update sending window

    Update a business calendar sending window definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "channel": "SMS",
  "start": "string",
  "end": "string",
  "day": 1,
  "allowed": true
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    windowId path string true The SendingWindow definitions's id
    body body SendingWindow true The updated SendingWindow definition

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteSendingWindowById

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window/{windowId}


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window/{windowId} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com


    
$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/calendar/window/{windowId}',
  method: 'delete',

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

{
  method: 'DELETE'

})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  params: {
  }

p JSON.parse(result)

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    DELETE /calendar/window/{windowId}

    Remove sending window by id

    Remove a specific business calendar sending window definition

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    windowId path string true The SendingWindow definitions's id

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getSendingWindowByComponent

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /calendar/window/component/{component}

    Get a list sending windows by component type

    Get a list of business calendar sending window definitions fitered by component type

    Role: ROLE_BUSINESS_CALENDAR Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    component path string true The SendingWindow definitions's ComponentType

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "id": "423-dfgsd-35423-asdf-52q345",
      "component": "FRAUD_ALERT",
      "start": "09:00",
      "end": "17:00",
      "day": 1,
      "allowed": true,
      "channel": "SMS"
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [SendingWindow] false No description
    » Daily Sending Window SendingWindow false No description
    »» id string false The unique reference, for this SendingWindow entry
    »» component string false The component, that this SendingWindow applies to
    »» channel string false The message channel, that this SendingWindow applies to
    »» start string true The window start time (time-hour ":" time-minute - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »» end string true The window end time (time-hour ":" time-minute - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »» day integer true The calendar day (Sunday=1, Monday=2, Tuesday=3, Wednesday=4, Thursday=5, Friday=6, Saturday=7)
    »» allowed boolean true Is sending permitted, at all, on this day (i.e. if set to false, then the SendingWindow for the entire day is closed)

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    channel SMS
    channel EMAIL
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Campaign

    get__campaign

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    return res.json();

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /campaign

    List Campaigns

    This call will return a list of Campaigns, defined in the system.

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: Campaign[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    component query string false The 'business-unit' that this configuration belongs to.
    name query string false Lookup a specific campaign by its name.
    type query string false The logical campaign 'type' (i.e. payment, contact, etc).
    page query string false The results page to retrieve.
    pageSize query string false The number of results to retrieve.
    sort query string false The field to order by.
    dir query string false The sorting direction [desc, asc].

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__campaign_process

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/process \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/process HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json

  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/process',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

  "startDate": 0,
  "campaignId": 0,
  "processVariables": {
    "key1": "string",
    "key2": "string",
    "key3": "string"
  }
}';

  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/process", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /campaign/process

    Start Campaign

    This call will initiate a campaign process for the identified customer/account. - Permission: EXECUTE - Identified: CustomerVO - Identified: CustomerAccountVO - Synchronised: CustomerVO - Synchronised: CustomerAccountVO - Request Object CampaignProcessRequest

    Body parameter

    {
  "startDate": 0,
  "campaignId": 0,
  "processVariables": {
    "key1": "string",
    "key2": "string",
    "key3": "string"
  }
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » startDate body number false No description
    » campaignId body number false No description
    » processVariables body object false No description
    »» key1 body string false No description
    »» key2 body string false No description
    »» key3 body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found None
    409 Conflict Conflict Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    delete__campaign_process

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/process?campaignId=string \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    DELETE /campaign/process

    Cancel Campaign

    This call will cancel a campaign process for the identified customer/account.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Identified: CustomerAccountVO

    • Synchronised: CustomerVO

    • Synchronised: CustomerAccountVO

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    campaignId query string true The campaign to delete.

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    400 Bad Request Bad Request None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    StartCampaign

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

const inputBody = '{
  "startDate": "2018-04-05",
  "campaign": "string",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  },
  "plan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}';

  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

    package main

import (

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /campaign/processV2

    Start high-priority campaign instance/s

    This call will initiate a high-priority campaign process for the included customer/s & account/s. This request can also be used to update the specified customer/s and account/s.

    Role: ROLE_CAMPAIGN
    Permission: EXECUTE

    Body parameter

    {
  "startDate": "2018-04-05",
  "campaign": "string",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  },
  "plan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body StartCampaignRequest true The POST body, consisting of campaign instance & embedded placement data

    Example responses

    {
  "value": {
    "description": "",
    "attributes": {
      "campaign_request_id": "welcome1"
    }
  }
}

    {
  "value": {
    "description": "No matching campaign found for name: Welcome1",
    "attributes": {
      "campaign_request_id": "Welcome1"
    }
  }
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    202 Accepted Resource data has been accepted for processing. StartCampaignResponse
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. StartCampaignResponse
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    StartBatchCampaign

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "startDate": "2018-04-05",
  "campaign": "string",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  },
  "plan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/processbatch", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /campaign/processbatch

    Start low-priority campaign instance/s

    This call will initiate a low-priority campaign process for the included customer/s & account/s. This request can also be used to update the specified customer/s and account/s.

    Role: ROLE_CAMPAIGN
    Permission: EXECUTE

    Body parameter

    {
  "startDate": "2018-04-05",
  "campaign": "string",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  },
  "plan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body StartCampaignRequest true The POST body, consisting of campaign instance & embedded placement data

    Example responses

    {
  "value": {
    "description": "",
    "attributes": {
      "campaign_request_id": "welcome1"
    }
  }
}

    {
  "value": {
    "description": "No matching campaign found for name: Welcome1",
    "attributes": {
      "campaign_request_id": "Welcome1"
    }
  }
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    202 Accepted Resource data has been accepted for processing. StartCampaignResponse
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. StartCampaignResponse
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    cancelCampaign

    Code samples

  }

)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/campaign/process/{id}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /campaign/process/{id}

    Terminate a campaign process instance

    This call will terminate a running campaign process, identified by the supplied startCampaignRequest.id

    Role: ROLE_CAMPAIGN
    Permission: EXECUTE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    id path string true The startCampaignRequest.id
    reason query string false An optional reason, for the cancellation of the campaign

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Customer

    get__customer

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();

    GET /customer

    Retrieve customer

    Fetch information of the customer in session.

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Response Object: CustomerVO

    Example responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline

    POST /customer/address

    Create customer address

    Add address to the customer's address list. The sequence in Address is important as it specified the order of the address in the list of addresses of the Customer

    • Permission: CREATE

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Request Object: CustomerAddressVO

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put__customer_address

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  'Accept':'application/json'

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    PUT /customer/address

    Update customer address

    Update address in the customer's address list. The id identifies the address and the sequence in Address is important as it specified the order of the address in the list of addresses of the Customer

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Request Object: CustomerAddressVO

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    delete_customer_address:addressId

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/address/:addressId \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/address/:addressId HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/address/:addressId',
  method: 'delete',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  'Accept':'application/json'

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();

  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/address/:addressId");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/address/:addressId", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /customer/address/:addressId

    Delete customer address

    Delete address in the customer's address list. The id identifies the address

    • Permission: DELETE

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__customer_contact

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/contact',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'POST',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

  "arrears": "string",
  "total": "string"
}';

  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers

    return res.json();

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/account/attributes", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /customer/account/attributes

    Update customer's account attibutes

    Fetch existing customer account

    • Permission: UPDATE

    • Identified: CustomerAccountVO

    • Response Object: CustomerAccountVO

    Body parameter

    {
  "arrears": "string",
  "total": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » arrears body string false No description
    » total body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    startPaymentPlan

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/plan \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/plan',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "replace": true,
  "paymentPlan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/plan',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});
