    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/plan", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/plan

    Start a payment plan

    Start a payment plan, for the given customer & account

    Role: ROLE_PAYMENT Permission: EXECUTE

    Body parameter

    {
  "replace": true,
  "paymentPlan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    customerId path string true The customer, being billed
    accountId path string true The account, being paid
    body body StartPaymentPlanRequest true The POST request, consisting of the instance of the User Body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    202 Accepted Payment plan accepted for processing. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    startPayment

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "singlePayment": {
    "id": "string",
    "reference": "string",
    "wallet": "string",
    "amount": 0,
    "currency": "string",
    "ruleName": "string",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "whenComplete": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "status": "WAITING",
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    }
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/payment

    Make Payment

    Make a one-off payment, for the given customer & account

    Role: ROLE_PAYMENT Permission: EXECUTE

    Body parameter

    {
  "singlePayment": {
    "id": "string",
    "reference": "string",
    "wallet": "string",
    "amount": 0,
    "currency": "string",
    "ruleName": "string",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "whenComplete": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "status": "WAITING",
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    }
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    customerId path string true The customer, being billed
    accountId path string true The account, being paid
    body body StartSinglePaymentRequest true The Payment request

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    202 Accepted Payment accepted for processing. None
    400 Bad Request Payment declined/invalid. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getAllIeForms

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/ie',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {

}).then(function(body) {

  'Accept' => 'application/json'

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

}, headers = headers)

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/ie");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/ie", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /customer/{customerId}/account/{accountId}/ie

    Get all customer and account I&E forms

    Retrieve all I&E forms, for the specified customer and account.

    Role: ROLE_IE Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    customerId path string true The customer, filling out the form
    accountId path string true The account, being paid
    status query string false Filter the resultset to only include I&E forms with the specified status
    page query integer false The resultset page number
    size query integer false The number of results-per-page, to include in the resultset
    sort query string false Sort the resultset by the specified field
    direction query string false The resultset sort direction

    Enumerated Values

    Parameter Value
    status NEW
    status IN_PROGRESS
    status COMPLETE
    status CANCELLED
    status TIMEOUT
    sort whenLogged
    sort whenCompleted
    sort totalExpenditure
    direction ASCENDING
    direction DESCENDING

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "id": "string",
    "status": "NEW",
    "totalIncome": 0,
    "totalExpenditure": 0,
    "updatedBySavingCalc": "CUSTOMER",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "whenCompleted": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "answers": [
      {
        "value": "string",
        "notes": "string",
        "period": "WEEKLY",
        "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
        "questionName": "string",
        "questionDescription": "string",
        "questionGroup": {
          "name": "string",
          "sequence": 0,
          "whenLogged": "string",
          "parent": null
        }
      }
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [IeForm] false No description
    » I&E Form IeForm false Income and expenditure details form, filled-out and submitted by a customer.
    »» id string false The unique reference, for this entry
    »» status string false The status of this I&E form
    »» totalIncome number(double) false The calculated total customer income amount
    »» totalExpenditure number(double) false The calculated total customer expenditure amount
    »» updatedBySavingCalc string false An optional flag that indicates the basis for the calculation
    »» whenLogged string(date-time) false The date-time this form was created (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »» whenCompleted string(date-time) false The date-time this form was completed (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »» answers [IeAnswer] false The list of customer supplied I&E information
    »»» I&E Answer IeAnswer false Customer supplied answer, to an I&E question
    »»»» value string true The actual answer value
    »»»» notes string false Customer supplied additional information
    »»»» period string false Customer indication of a regulary re-occuring I&E line-item
    »»»» whenLogged string(date-time) false The date-time this answer was submitted (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »»»» questionName string true The name of the I&E question, being answered
    »»»» questionDescription string false A short description, of the I&E question, being answered
    »»»» questionGroup IeGroup false An I&E line-item question group
    »»»»» name string true The unique name of this I&E question group
    »»»»» sequence integer false The index order of this group of I&E questions
    »»»»» whenLogged string false When this I&E question group was added (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »»»»» parent IeGroup false An I&E line-item question group

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    status NEW
    status IN_PROGRESS
    status COMPLETE
    status CANCELLED
    status TIMEOUT
    updatedBySavingCalc CUSTOMER
    updatedBySavingCalc OPTOUT
    updatedBySavingCalc CALCULATED
    period WEEKLY
    period MONTHLY
    period QUARTERLY
    period ANNUALLY
    period BIWEEKLY
    period HALFYEAR
    period FOURWEEKLY

    Response Headers

    Status Header Type Format Description
    200 X-fullResultSize integer The full count of all matching I&E forms
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Customer Search

    get__customersearch

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customersearch?lastName=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60Smith%60%29&postCode=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60EC2M%202QS%60%29&phoneNumber=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60447123456789%60%29&accountNumber=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60123456789%60%29&customData=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60custom%60%29 \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  'Accept': 'application/json'

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customersearch?lastName=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60Smith%60%29&postCode=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60EC2M%202QS%60%29&phoneNumber=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60447123456789%60%29&accountNumber=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60123456789%60%29&customData=%60%60%20%28optional%2C%20String%2C%20%60custom%60%29");

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customersearch", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /customersearch

    Retrieve Customer Accounts according to the search criteria

    Fetch customer accounts. If multiple search criteria are used, the result will contain will contain all accounts that match at least one of the search terms.

    The following rules will apply:

    1. At least two characters have to exist in the search term.

    2. The wild card * can be used once at the end of the search term.

    3. At least one search term has to exist.

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: CustomerAccountVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    lastName query string true Search using last name. Allows wild card at the end.
    postCode query string true Search using the post code. Allows wild card at the end.
    phoneNumber query string true Search using the Phone Number. Doesn't allow wildcard.
    accountNumber query string true Search using customer account. Doesn't allow wildcard.
    customData query string true Search using custom data. Allows wild card at the end.
    page query string false The results page to retrieve.
    pageSize query string false The number of results to retrieve.
    sort query string false The field to order by.
    dir query string false The sorting direction [desc, asc].

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put_customersearch_select_account:accountId

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customersearch/select/account/:accountId \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customersearch/select/account/:accountId HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customersearch/select/account/:accountId',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  'Accept':'application/json'

  headers: headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /customersearch/select/account/:accountId

    Set the selected account in session

    Set the selected account in session, and returns the list of customers linked with this account.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Response Object: CustomerVO[]

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put_customersearch_select_customer:customerId

    Code samples

  }
})

    PUT /customersearch/select/customer/:customerId

    Set the selected account in session

    Set the selected account in session.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Event

    post__event

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "eventName": "string",
  "customerId": 0,
  "accountId": 0,
  "serviceAlertId": 0,
  "eventContextMap": {}
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /event

    Publish Event

    This method will publish a TasEvent to the rules engine. This may in turn trigger additional behaviour (if the rules engine is configured to do so).

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Request Object: TasEvent

    Body parameter

    {
  "eventName": "string",
  "customerId": 0,
  "accountId": 0,
  "serviceAlertId": 0,
  "eventContextMap": {}
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » eventName body string false No description
    » customerId body number false No description
    » accountId body number false No description
    » serviceAlertId body number false No description
    » eventContextMap body object false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getEventNames

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.get 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.get('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/event", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /reference/event

    A list of all event names

    Retrieve a list of all event names

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "name": "string",
    "description": "string"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [EventName] false No description
    » Event name definition EventName false A business event, that occurs during processing
    »» name string true The event key/name
    »» description string false An explanation of the meaning, of this event
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getEvents

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/eventV2 \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/eventV2 HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/eventV2',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/eventV2',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()

HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/eventV2", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /eventV2

    A list of all configured event rules grouped by event name

    Retrieve a list of all configured events.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "event": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "rules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "filters": [
          {
            "type": "string",
            "value": "string"
          }
        ],
        "actions": [
          {
            "actionType": "string"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [Event] false No description
    » An event definition Event false A mapping of event and rules
    »» event string true The event, being returned
    »» description string false A meaningful description, for this action
    »» rules [EventRule] true A list of all event rules, for this event
    »»» An event rule definition EventRule false A mapping of filters and actions, when a specific event occurs
    »»»» id string false The reference id
    »»»» filters [EventFilter] false Filters for this event
    »»»»» Event-filter mapping EventFilter false Event Filters
    »»»»»» type string false Type of filter
    »»»»»» value string false Value of filter
    »»»»» actions [EventAction] false Actions event
    »»»»»» Event-action EventAction false Event Actions
    »»»»»»» actionType string true Name of the action type
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getEventByName

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/{name} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/{name} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/{name}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/{name}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /event/{name}

    A configured event definition

    Retrieve a specific event by name.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    name path string true The name of the event

    Example responses

    {
  "event": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "rules": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "filters": [
        {
          "type": "string",
          "value": "string"
        }
      ],
      "actions": [
        {
          "actionType": "string"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Event
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    createEventRule

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain'

Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: text/plain

  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'text/plain'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "filters": [
    {
      "type": "string",
      "value": "string"
    }
  ],
  "actions": [
    {
      "actionType": "string"
    }
  ]
}';

  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'text/plain'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /event/rule

    Create a event rule definition

    Add a new event rule definition.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "filters": [
    {
      "type": "string",
      "value": "string"
    }
  ],
  "actions": [
    {
      "actionType": "string"
    }
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body EventRule true The new event rule to add

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getEventRuleById

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

Host: your-instance.telrock.com

    package main

       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /event/rule/{ruleId}

    A configured event rule definition

    Retrieve a configured event rule definition.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    ruleId path string true The id of the event rule

    Example responses

    {
  "id": "string",
  "filters": [
    {
      "type": "string",
      "value": "string"
    }
  ],
  "actions": [
    {
      "actionType": "string"
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. EventRule
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateEventRuleById

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /event/rule/{ruleId}

    Update an event rule definition

    Update an existing event rule definition.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "filters": [
    {
      "type": "string",
      "value": "string"
    }
  ],
  "actions": [
    {
      "actionType": "string"
    }
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    ruleId path string true The id of the event rule
    body body EventRule true The event to update

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteEventRuleById

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId}


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId}',
  method: 'delete',

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

{
  method: 'DELETE'

})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'

  params: {
  }

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId}', params={

)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId}");

con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/event/rule/{ruleId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /event/rule/{ruleId}

    Delete an event rule definition

    Remove an event rule definition.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    ruleId path string true The id of the event rule

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    ID&V (Customer Login)

    post__idv_process

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = 'string';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /idv/process

    Retrieve Questions

    This initial call will start a new ID&V process. The request can either be empty, or contain the 1-time hashcode.

    • Request Object: (empty body) or hash-code

    • Response Object: IdvQuestionVO[]

    • Synchronised: Web Session

    Body parameter

    "string"

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    501 Not Implemented Not Implemented Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put__idv_process

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/idv/process',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '[
  {
    "answer": "string",
    "idvQuestionVO": {
      "id": "string"
    }
  }
]';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /idv/process

    Submit Answers

    This method will evaluate the submitted answers and return the identified CustomerVO and CustomerAccountVO objects. A successful ID&V answer will also authenticate the user with the customer action group.

    • Request Object: IDVAnswerVO[]

    • Response Object: IdvIdentityVO

    • Synchronised: Web Session

    Body parameter

    [
  {
    "answer": "string",
    "idvQuestionVO": {
      "id": "string"
    }
  }
]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body array[object] false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    409 Conflict Conflict Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    I&E (Income and Expenditure)

    get__ie_item

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/item \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/item HTTP/1.1

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    GET /ie/item

    Retrieve Questions

    This initial call will fetch all available questions regardless of user type. The response object will be an array of questions.

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: IeItemVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    groupName query string false A group name to filter by.
    questionType query string false The type of questions to retrieve.
    page query string false The results page to retrieve.
    pageSize query string false The number of results to retrieve.
    sort query string false The field to order by (any field).
    dir query string false The sorting direction [desc, asc].

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    get__ie_group

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/group \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

    GET /ie/group

    Retrieve Groups

    This initial call will fetch all IeGroupVO definitions (including all sub-groups and questions).

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: IeGroupVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    page query string false The results page to retrieve.
    pageSize query string false The number of results to retrieve.

    dir query string false The sorting direction [desc, asc].

    GET /ie/form

    Retrieve Forms

    This initial call will fetch matching IeFormVO definitions (including all previous answers).

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Identified: CustomerAccountVO

    • Response Object: IeFormVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    includeComplete query boolean false Should completed forms be included.
    page query string false The results page to retrieve.
    pageSize query string false The number of results to retrieve.
    sort query string false The field to order by.
    dir query string false The sorting direction [desc, asc].

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put__ie_form

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/form \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/form HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json

  'Content-Type':'application/json',

  success: function(data) {

    PUT /ie/form

    Update IE Form attibutes

    • Permission: UPDATE

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Identified: CustomerAccountVO

    • Response Object: IeFormVO

    Body parameter

    {
  "ie.savings": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » ie.savings body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put_ie_form_summarize:formId

    Code samples

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

    package main

import (

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /ie/form/summarize/:formId

    Summarize Form

    This call will result in trigger figure rules being executed for the given form and returns the form along with any trigger figure rule validation info messages.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Identified: CustomerAccountVO

    • Response Object: IeFormVO

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__ie_process

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /ie/process

    Start/Continue

    This method will either resume a previous I&E process or start a new one.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Identified: Customer

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Synchronised: Customer

    • Synchronised: CustomerAccount

    • Response Object: long[]

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put__ie_process

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "value": "string",
  "notes": "string",
  "period": "string",
  "ieItemVO": {
    "id": 0
  }
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.put 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/ie/process", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /ie/process

    Save Answers

    This method will evaluate the submitted answers and return an array of the groups to display, to the customer, by their id's.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Identified: Customer

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Synchronised: Customer

    • Synchronised: CustomerAccount

    • Request Object: IeItemAnswer[]

    • Response Object: long[]

    Body parameter

    {
  "value": "string",
  "notes": "string",
  "period": "string",
  "ieItemVO": {
    "id": 0
  }
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » value body string false No description
    » notes body string false No description
    » period body string false No description
    » ieItemVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    POST /message

    Send Message

    This call will schedule a message for sending, according to the included MessageSettings - Permission: EXECUTE

    • Request Object MessageRequest

    • Response Object: messageReference

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline

    GET /message/group

    List Groups

    This call will return a list of message template groups, defined in the system.

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: MessageTemplateGroup[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    name query string false The name of the group to retrieve.
    page query string false The results page to retrieve.
    pageSize query string false The number of results to retrieve.
    sort query string false The field to order by.
    dir query string false The sorting direction [desc, asc].

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    get__message_template

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

    GET /message/template

    List Templates

    This call will return a list of message templates, defined in the system.

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: MessageTemplate[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    group query string false The name of the group to filter by.
    name query string false The name of the template to retrieve.
    brand query string false The name of the brand to filter by.
    type query string false The channel type to filter by.
    page query string false The results page to retrieve.
    pageSize query string false The number of results to retrieve.
    sort query string false The field to order by.
    dir query string false The sorting direction [desc, asc].

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Payments

    GET /payment/type

    Get Payment Rules

    This call will check the specified customer's payment sources and payment options for the identified customerAccountId. It will also return the recommended defaults and validation rules for creating a new payment/plan.

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: Customer

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Response Object: PaymentTypeRulesVO

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    get__payment_payment

    GET /payment/payment

    Retrieve Payments that does not have payment plan

    List all payments that does not have payment plans.

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: Customer

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Response Object: PaymentVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    status query string false By default, retrieves all payments...

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__payment_validate

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "paymentTypeRuleName": "string",
  "paymentSourceVO": {
    "id": 0,
    "customerVO": {
      "id": 0
    }
  },
  "customerAccountVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "amount": 0,
  "currency": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/validate", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /payment/validate

    Validate Payment

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: Customer

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Request Object: Payment

    Body parameter

    {
  "paymentTypeRuleName": "string",
  "paymentSourceVO": {
    "id": 0,
    "customerVO": {
      "id": 0
    }
  },
  "customerAccountVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "amount": 0,
  "currency": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body Body false No description
    » paymentTypeRuleName body string false No description
    » paymentSourceVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description
    »» customerVO body object false No description
    »»» id body number false No description
    »» customerAccountVO body object false No description
    »»» id body number false No description
    »» amount body number false No description
    »» currency body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    400 Bad Request Bad Request None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__payment_process

    Code samples

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/process", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /payment/process

    Start Process

    This call will start a new 'Payment Now' by passing the submitted PaymentVO. The response will contain.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Identified: Customer

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Synchronised: Customer

    • Synchronised: CustomerAccount

    • Request Object: Payment

    Body parameter

    {
  "paymentTypeRuleName": "string",
  "paymentSourceVO": {
    "id": 0,
    "customerVO": {
      "id": 0
    }
  },
  "customerAccountVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "amount": 0,
  "currency": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body Body false No description
    » paymentTypeRuleName body string false No description
    » paymentSourceVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description
    »» customerVO body object false No description
    »»» id body number false No description
    »» customerAccountVO body object false No description
    »»» id body number false No description
    »» amount body number false No description
    »» currency body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    500 Internal Server Error Internal Server Error Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    get__payment_plan

    GET /payment/plan

    Retrieve Payment Plans

    List all payment plans for the current identified customerAccountId.

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Response Object: PaymentPlanVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    status query string false By default, retrieves all plans...

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__payment_plan_validate

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/plan/process", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /payment/plan/process

    Start Process

    This call will start a new 'Schedule Payment Process' by passing the submitted PaymentPlanVO. The response will be an empty body, since the payment process is actually asynchronous.

    • Permission: EXECUTE

    • Identified: Customer

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Synchronised: Customer

    • Synchronised: CustomerAccount

    • Request Object: PaymentPlanVO

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    replaceIfExisting query boolean false By default "false", starts the process without cancelling any existing plans. If "true", an existing plan will be cancelled before starting the new plan process.

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    400 Bad Request Bad Request None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    delete_payment_plan_process:planId

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/plan/process/:planId \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/plan/process/:planId HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/plan/process/:planId',
  method: 'delete',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/payment/plan/process/:planId',
{
  method: 'DELETE',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'

  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    package main

       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    }

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /payment/plan/process/:planId

    Cancel a Plan Process

    This method will publish a cancelPlan event into the process engine (for the submitted paymentPlanId & the identified customerId & customerAccountId). This will cancel the payment, at whatever stage it is at.

    • Permission: DELETE

    • Identified: CustomerAccount

    • Synchronised: Customer

    • Synchronised: CustomerAccount

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Product Configurations

    get__productconfig

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /productconfig

    Get Product Config

    This will return a list all the product configs for a given brand, component and key. If not provided, it retrieves all product configurations.

    • Permission: READ

    • Response Object: ProductConfigVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    brand query string false Brand Name.
    component query string false Component Name.
    key query string false Key name.

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__productconfig

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "brandVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "refComponentVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "key": "string",
  "value": "string",
  "description": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)

  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

}, headers = headers)

    response.append(inputLine);

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /productconfig

    Add ProductConfig

    • Permission: Create

    • Request Object: ProductConfigVO

    Body parameter

    {
  "brandVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "refComponentVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "key": "string",
  "value": "string",
  "description": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » brandVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description
    » refComponentVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description
    » key body string false No description
    » value body string false No description
    » description body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline
    409 Conflict Conflict Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    put__productconfig

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": 0,
  "brandVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "refComponentVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "key": "string",
  "value": "string",
  "description": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.put 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /productconfig

    Update ProductConfig

    • Permission: Update

    • Request Object: ProductConfigVO

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": 0,
  "brandVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "refComponentVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "key": "string",
  "value": "string",
  "description": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » id body number false No description
    » brandVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description
    » refComponentVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description
    » key body string false No description
    » value body string false No description
    » description body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline
    409 Conflict Conflict Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    delete_productconfig{productConfigId}

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig/{productConfigId} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'
