Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig/{productConfigId}',
  method: 'delete',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig/{productConfigId}',
{
  method: 'DELETE',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.delete 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig/{productConfigId}',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig/{productConfigId}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig/{productConfigId}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/productconfig/{productConfigId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /properties

    Retrieve All Properties

    This initial call will fetch all properties as a map.

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    brand query string false Properties for the selected brand.

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    get_properties:property_key

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/properties/:property_key \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/properties/:property_key HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/properties/:property_key',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /wallet/paymentsource

    Retrieve Payment Sources

    Fetch existing payment sources, for the currently identified customer. Results are sorted by sequence.

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Response Object: PaymentSourceVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    type query string false The type of payment sources to retrieve.
    status query string false By default, retrieves the active payment sources...
    includeInactive query boolean false By default its false meaning it will only retreive active payment sources.

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    post__wallet_paymentsource

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "customerVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "name": "string",
  "sequence": 0,
  "type": "string",
  "status": null,
  "reference": null,
  "attributes": {
    "Security Code": "string",
    "Expiry Date": "string"
  },
  "accountNumber": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'

  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)

}, headers = headers)

import (

func main() {

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /wallet/paymentsource

    Add a Payment Source

    This call will start a process for adding a new payment source.

    • Permission: CREATE

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Request Object: PaymentSource

    Body parameter

    {
  "customerVO": {
    "id": 0
  },
  "name": "string",
  "sequence": 0,
  "type": "string",
  "status": null,
  "reference": null,
  "attributes": {
    "Security Code": "string",
    "Expiry Date": "string"
  },
  "accountNumber": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body object false No description
    » customerVO body object false No description
    »» id body number false No description
    » name body string false No description
    » sequence body number false No description
    » type body string false No description
    » status body any false No description
    » reference body any false No description
    » attributes body object false No description
    »» Security Code body string false No description
    »» Expiry Date body string false No description
    » accountNumber body string false No description

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    delete_wallet_paymentsource:id

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource/:id \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource/:id HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  method: 'delete',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /wallet/paymentsource/:id

    Delete a Payment Source

    De-activate a selected payment source.

    • Permission: DELETE

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    get__wallet_paymentsource_type

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource/type \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource/type HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource/type',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource/type");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/paymentsource/type", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /wallet/paymentsource/type

    Payment Source Rules

    Check which payment sources are allowed

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: CustomerVO

    • Response Object: String[] CREDIT_CARD, DEBIT_CARD, DIRECT_DEBIT, CHEQUE, PAYPAL, GOOGLE_PAY, AMAZON_PAY

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    get__wallet_rules

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/rules \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/rules HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/wallet/rules',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    GET /wallet/rules

    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /wallet/plan/:id/paymentsource

    Lookup Plan Wallet

    Retrieve payment sources, from the indicated plan.

    • Permission: READ

    • Identified: CustomerAccountVO

    • Response Object: PaymentPlanWalletVO[]

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    status query string false By default, retrieves the active payment sources...

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized Inline
    404 Not Found Not Found Inline

    getAllCustomerWallets

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /customer/{customerId}/wallet

    List all payment sources, for the selected customer

    Get a list of all payment sources, for the selected customer

    Role: ROLE_WALLET
    Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    customerId path string true The unique reference for the customer

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "id": "string",
    "sequence": 0,
    "name": "string",
    "accountNumber": "string",
    "expiryDate": "string",
    "sortCode": "string",
    "nameOnCard": "string",
    "securityCode": "string",
    "type": "CREDIT_CARD",
    "status": "PRE_VALIDATION",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "pspReference": "string"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [Wallet] false No description
    » Customer Wallet Wallet false A customers payment source entry
    »» id string true The unique reference, for this entry
    »» sequence integer true The payment source order, for the customer (lower value means higher priority)
    »» name string true A memorable name, for this wallet entry
    »» accountNumber string true The payment source account number
    »» expiryDate string false The [CREDIT_CARD, DEBIT_CARD] expiry date (M/yy, MM/yy or MM/yyyy)
    »» sortCode string false For [DIRECT_DEBIT, ACH_CHECKING_ACCOUNT, ACH_SAVINGS_ACCOUNT] types
    »» nameOnCard string false The printed name, on the payment card
    »» securityCode string false The CVV security code. This field will only contain a value when adding a new card.
    »» type string true The payment source type
    »» status string false The status, of this wallet entry
    »» whenLogged string(date-time) false The date this payment source was added
    »» pspReference string false A PSP tokenised reference, for this payment source

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    type CREDIT_CARD
    type DEBIT_CARD
    type DIRECT_DEBIT
    type ACH_CHECKING_ACCOUNT
    type ACH_SAVINGS_ACCOUNT
    status PRE_VALIDATION
    status VALIDATION_FAILED
    status ACTIVE
    status DEACTIVATED
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    addCustomerWallet

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "sequence": 0,
  "name": "string",
  "accountNumber": "string",
  "expiryDate": "string",
  "sortCode": "string",
  "nameOnCard": "string",
  "securityCode": "string",
  "type": "CREDIT_CARD",
  "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "pspReference": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /customer/{customerId}/wallet

    Get payment sources by customer

    Add a new payment source, for the selected customer

    Role: ROLE_WALLET
    Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "sequence": 0,
  "name": "string",
  "accountNumber": "string",
  "expiryDate": "string",
  "sortCode": "string",
  "nameOnCard": "string",
  "securityCode": "string",
  "type": "CREDIT_CARD",
  "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "pspReference": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    customerId path string true The unique reference for the customer
    body body Wallet true The POST body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getCustomerWallet

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet/{walletId} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet/{walletId} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/customer/{customerId}/wallet/{walletId}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    GET /customer/{customerId}/wallet/{walletId}

    Get payment source by customer

    Role: ROLE_WALLET
    Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    customerId path string true The unique reference for the customer
    walletId path string true The unique reference for the customer

    Example responses

    {
  "id": "string",
  "sequence": 0,
  "name": "string",
  "accountNumber": "string",
  "expiryDate": "string",
  "sortCode": "string",
  "nameOnCard": "string",
  "securityCode": "string",
  "type": "CREDIT_CARD",
  "status": "PRE_VALIDATION",
  "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "pspReference": "string"
}

    200 OK Operation is successful. Wallet
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /customer/{customerId}/wallet/{walletId}

    Delete payment source by customer

    Remove a specific payment source, for the selected customer

    Role: ROLE_WALLET
    Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    customerId path string true The unique reference for the customer
    walletId path string true The unique reference for the customer

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content The payment source was successfully deleted None
    400 Bad Request This payment source is attached to an active plan. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Brand

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /brand

    List all the configured brands

    Retrieve a list of all the configured brands.

    Role: ROLE_BRANDING
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "id": "1",
      "name": "Virgin Travel",
      "defaultBrand": true,
      "country": "GBR",
      "alias": [
        "VT"
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "2",
      "name": "Virgin Money",
      "defaultBrand": false,
      "country": "GBR",
      "alias": [
        "VM"
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "3",
      "name": "Virgin TV",
      "defaultBrand": false,
      "country": "GBR",
      "alias": [
        "VTV"
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "4",
      "name": "Virgin Health",
      "defaultBrand": false,
      "country": "GBR",
      "alias": [
        "VH"
      ]
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [Brand] false No description
    » Brand Brand false A client-configured logical brand
    »» name string true The brand name
    »» defaultBrand boolean false Is this the system-default brand
    »» country string false The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 or alpha-3 country-code
    »» alias [string] false A list of all alias, for this brand
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateBrand

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName}',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "defaultBrand": true,
  "country": "string",
  "alias": [
    "string"
  ]
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName}',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.put 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName}',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/brand/{brandName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /brand/{brandName}

    Update an existing brand.

    Update an existing brand.

    Role: ROLE_BRANDING Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "defaultBrand": true,
  "country": "string",
  "alias": [
    "string"
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    brandName path string true The name of the brand
    body body Brand true Brand

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Queue

    getQueues

  'Accept': 'application/json'

}, headers = headers)

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /reference/queue

    A list of all queues

    Retrieve a list of all queues.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "name": "string",
    "alias": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "priority": 0,
    "type": "string",
    "direction": "ONE_WAY",
    "expires": 0,
    "defaultQueue": true
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [Queue] false No description
    » A Queue definition Queue false A host-system queue definition
    »» name string true A host-system queue definition that can be used to filter event-actions
    »» alias string false An alias provided by user
    »» description string false A meaningful description for this queue definition
    »» priority integer false Queue priority ranking (used for determining whether to replace an already running fraud-case)
    »» type string false The type of transactions that occur on this queue
    »» direction string false Does this queue handle 1-way or 2-way cases
    »» expires integer false The number of minutes, to wait for a customer response, for this queue
    »» defaultQueue boolean false Is this the default queue (If no specific queue is specified, in the incoming case)?

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    direction ONE_WAY
    direction TWO_WAY
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    createQueue

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/plain'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: text/plain


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'text/plain'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "alias": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "priority": 0,
  "type": "string",
  "direction": "ONE_WAY",
  "expires": 0,
  "defaultQueue": true
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'text/plain'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

con.setRequestMethod("POST");

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;

while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();

    package main

       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"text/plain"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /reference/queue

    Create a new queue

    Create a new queue definition

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "alias": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "priority": 0,
  "type": "string",
  "direction": "ONE_WAY",
  "expires": 0,
  "defaultQueue": true
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body Queue true The Queue definition to add

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getQueueByName

    Code samples

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...

)

        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/queue/{queueName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /reference/queue/{queueName}

    Update a queue

    Update a queue definition.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "alias": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "priority": 0,
  "type": "string",
  "direction": "ONE_WAY",
  "expires": 0,
  "defaultQueue": true
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    queueName path string true The name of the queue
    body body Queue true The Queue definition to update

    Example responses

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteQueueByName

    DELETE /reference/queue/{queueName}

    Delete a queue definition

    Remove a queue definition.

    Role: ROLE_EVENT
    Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    queueName path string true The name of the queue

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Reference

    getReferenceComponents

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/reference/component", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /reference/component

    A list of all reference components

    Retrieve a list of all reference components

    Role: ROLE_REFERENCE
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "name": "string"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [ReferenceComponent] false No description
    » Reference component definition ReferenceComponent false A reference component definition
    »» name string false The name of reference component
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    GetLanguages

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.get 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.get('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/language", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /language

    A list of all languages

    Retrieve a list of all languages.

    Role: ROLE_LANGUAGE
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "code": "ENU",
      "name": "English (US)",
      "default": true
    },
    {
      "code": "ENG",
      "name": "English (UK)",
      "default": false
    },
    {
      "code": "ESP",
      "name": "Spanish",
      "default": false
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [Language] false No description
    » Language Language false Language
    »» code string true The Language Code
    »» name string true The label of the language
    »» default boolean false Is this the default language
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Template

    GetTemplates

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {

HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /template

    List all message templates

    Get all the message templates that match the search criteria.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    brand query string false The name of the brand
    component query string false The name of the template component
    type query string false The type of the message template
    searchText query string false The text to be searched in a template

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "id": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "component": "string",
    "brand": "string",
    "channel": "string",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "messages": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "status": "string",
        "subject": "string",
        "message": "string",
        "plugin_body": "string",
        "language": "string",
        "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
      }
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [MessageTemplate] false No description
    » Message template MessageTemplate false A message template details that is used to send a message
    »» id string false host reference value
    »» name string true The template name
    »» component string true The template component name
    »» brand string true The brand Name
    »» channel string true The type of the message either SMS/EMAIL
    »» whenLogged string(date-time) false The Creation date and time of the template (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »» messages [MessageTemplateBody] false A list of all message template bodies, for this message template
    »»» Message template Body MessageTemplateBody false A message template Body for a language
    »»»» id string false host reference value
    »»»» status string true The status of the template DRAFT/ACTIVE/DELETED
    »»»» subject string false The subject of the message
    »»»» message string true The body of the message
    »»»» plugin_body string true The plugin information for the message required by frontend to render the message
    »»»» language string true The language code/name
    »»»» whenLogged string(date-time) false The Creation date and time of the template body (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    createTemplate

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "brand": "string",
  "channel": "string",
  "messages": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "status": "string",
      "subject": "string",
      "message": "string",
      "plugin_body": "string",
      "language": "string"
    }
  ]
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

}, headers = headers)

HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /template

    Create a new message template.

    Create a new message template. Message templates are used for the messages for the alerts that are sent to the customers. If any bodies are included, then they will be created too.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "brand": "string",
  "channel": "string",
  "messages": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "status": "string",
      "subject": "string",
      "message": "string",
      "plugin_body": "string",
      "language": "string"
    }
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body MessageTemplate true Message Template Details

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateTemplate

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    PUT /template/{templateId}

    Update an existing message template.

    Update an existing message template.Even if the body is provided, it will not store the values to the database.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "brand": "string",
  "channel": "string",
  "messages": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "status": "string",
      "subject": "string",
      "message": "string",
      "plugin_body": "string",
      "language": "string"
    }
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    templateId path string true The id of the message template
    body body MessageTemplate true Message Template

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    DELETE /template/{templateId}

    Delete a message template

    Delete a message template.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    templateId path string true The id of the template to be deleted

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /template/{templateId}/body

    Create a new message template body.

    Create a new body for the message template.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "status": "string",
  "subject": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "plugin_body": "string",
  "language": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    templateId path string true The id of the message memplate
    body body MessageTemplateBody true The POST request, consisting of the instance of the Message Template Body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateTemplateBody

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "status": "string",
  "subject": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "plugin_body": "string",
  "language": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.put 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}

    Update an existing message template body.

    Update an existing body of the message template.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "status": "string",
  "subject": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "plugin_body": "string",
  "language": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    templateId path string true The id of the message template
    templateBodyId path string true The id of the message template body
    body body MessageTemplateBody true The POST request, consisting of the instance of the message template body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteTemplateBody

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}

Host: your-instance.telrock.com

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}',
  method: 'delete',

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    import requests

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}', params={

)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    DELETE /template/{templateId}/body/{templateBodyId}

    Delete a message template body

    Delete the body of the message template.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    templateId path string true The id of the message template
    templateBodyId path string true The id of the template to be deleted

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    GET /template/formatter

    List all message template formatters

    Get all the message template formatters.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "name": "FraudNotificationWrapper_merchantname",
      "alias": "Merchant Name in fraud notification wrapper",
      "description": "The description field",
      "maxLength": 18,
      "exampleValue": "Merchant name",
      "converterType": "DEFAULT",
      "customFormat": "",
      "customName": 0
    },
    {
      "name": "FraudNotificationWrapper_tranAmount",
      "alias": "Transaction Amount in fraud notification wrapper",
      "description": "The description field",
      "maxLength": 9,
      "exampleValue": "Â£1000",
      "converterType": "NUMBER",
      "customFormat": "0.00",
      "customName": 0
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [Formatter] false No description
    » Message template formatter Formatter false A message template Formatter
    »» name string true The unique name of the formatter
    »» alias string false A user-defined name for this formatter
    »» description string false An explanation of the meaning, of this formatter
    »» maxLength integer true Max length for formatted value
    »» exampleValue string true Example value for this formatter
    »» converterType string true Convertor type (i.e. Default, number, date, datetime)
    »» customFormat string false Pattern for value formatting
    »» customName boolean false Flag to indicate custom name ( 0-no, 1-yes)
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getTemplateFormatterByName

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/formatter/{name} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/formatter/{name} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/formatter/{name}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    GET /template/formatter/{name}

    Get a message template formatter

    Get individual message template formatter by name.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER
    Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    name path string true The formatter name

    Example responses

    {
  "value": {
    "name": "FraudNotificationWrapper_merchantname",
    "alias": "Merchant Name in fraud notification wrapper",
    "description": "The description field",
    "maxLength": 18,
    "exampleValue": "Merchant name",
    "converterType": "DEFAULT",
    "customFormat": "",
    "customName": 0
  }
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Formatter
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateTemplateFormatter

  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.get('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/formatter/tags', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/formatter/tags");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/formatter/tags", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /template/formatter/tags

    List all dynamic tags

    Get all the injectable fields from domain model

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "name": "FraudNotificationWrapper_merchantname",
      "label": "Name of the Merchant"
    },
    {
      "name": "FraudNotificationWrapper_tranAmount",
      "label": "Transaction Amount"
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [DynamicTags] false No description
    » Dynamic Tags DynamicTags false A message that has to sent by SMS / EMAIL
    »» name string false The name of the dynamic tag
    »» label string false The description of the dynamic tag
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Template Group

    GetTemplateGroups

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/groups \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/groups HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/groups',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

}, headers = headers)

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/groups");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/template/groups", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /template/groups

    List all message template groups

    Retrieve a list of all the configured message template groups.

    Role: ROLE_TEMPLATE_MANAGER
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    "Smart Protect",
    "Smart Collect",
    "Smart Activate",
    "Smart Engage"
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Message

    sendMessage

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2 \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2 HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "channel": "SMS",
  "subject": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "recipient": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/messageV2", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /messageV2

    Send a message through SMS / EMAIL

    Sends a message through SMS / EMAIL. If any dynamic tags defined in a message, then it will replace with the example value

    Role: ROLE_MESSAGE Permission: EXECUTE

    Body parameter

    {
  "channel": "SMS",
  "subject": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "recipient": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body MessageRequest true Request object to send a message

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getKeywords

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /message/keyword

    List all the configured keywords

    Retrieve a list of all the configured keywords.

    Role: ROLE_KEYWORD Permission: READ

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "type": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "keywords": [
      {
        "name": "string",
        "priority": 0,
        "pattern": "string",
        "description": "string"
      }
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [KeywordIntent] false No description
    » keyword intent KeywordIntent false A keyword intent
    »» type string true The type of the Keyword
    »» description string false A meaningful description of this keyword intent
    »» keywords [Keyword] false A list of all keywords for this type
    »»» Keyword Keyword false A keyword
    »»»» name string true The unique reference, for this Keyword entry
    »»»» priority integer true The priority of the Keyword
    »»»» pattern string true The regular expression pattern
    »»»» description string false A meaningful description of this keyword entry
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getKeywordsByType

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /message/keyword/{keywordIntent}

    Get a specific keyword

    Retrieve a specific keyword identified by unique keyword intent

    Role: ROLE_KEYWORD Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    keywordIntent path string true The unique reference for the keyword intent

    Example responses

    {}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    » keyword intent KeywordIntent false A keyword intent
    »» type string true The type of the Keyword
    »» description string false A meaningful description of this keyword intent
    »» keywords [Keyword] false A list of all keywords for this type
    »»» Keyword Keyword false A keyword
    »»»» name string true The unique reference, for this Keyword entry
    »»»» priority integer true The priority of the Keyword
    »»»» pattern string true The regular expression pattern
    »»»» description string false A meaningful description of this keyword entry
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    createKeyword

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  "name": "string",

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /message/keyword/{keywordIntent}

    Create a new keyword

    Add a new keyword, which belongs to a unique keyword intent

    Role: ROLE_KEYWORD Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "priority": 0,
  "pattern": "string",
  "description": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    keywordIntent path string true The unique reference for the keyword intent
    body body Keyword true The POST body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getKeywordByName

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}

    Get a specific keyword

    Retrieve a specific keyword, which belongs to a unique keyword intent

    Role: ROLE_KEYWORD Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    keywordIntent path string true The unique reference for the keyword intent
    keywordName path string true The unique reference for the keyword name

    Example responses

    {}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    » Keyword Keyword false A keyword
    »» name string true The unique reference, for this Keyword entry
    »» priority integer true The priority of the Keyword
    »» pattern string true The regular expression pattern
    »» description string false A meaningful description of this keyword entry
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateKeyword

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json

  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

  "name": "string",
  "priority": 0,
  "pattern": "string",
  "description": "string"
}';

  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}");

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);
}
