    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}

    Update a specific keyword

    Update an existing keyword, which belongs to a unique keyword intent

    Role: ROLE_KEYWORD Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "priority": 0,
  "pattern": "string",
  "description": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    keywordIntent path string true The unique reference for the keyword intent
    keywordName path string true The unique reference for the keyword name
    body body Keyword true The PUT request, consisting of the instance of the Keyword Body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteKeyword

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com


    
$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}',
  method: 'delete',

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}',
{
  method: 'DELETE'

})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

result = RestClient.delete 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}',
  params: {
  }

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}', params={

)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /message/keyword/{keywordIntent}/{keywordName}

    Delete a specific keyword

    Remove an existing keyword, which belongs to a unique keyword intent

    Role: ROLE_KEYWORD Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    keywordIntent path string true The unique reference for the keyword intent
    keywordName path string true The unique reference for the keyword name

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getMatchingKeywordIntent

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget

  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "text": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json',
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/matchType', params={

}, headers = headers)

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/matchType");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/keyword/matchType", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /message/keyword/matchType

    Get a matching keyword intent

    Retrieve a matching keyword intent, for a given input

    Role: ROLE_KEYWORD Permission: EXECUTE

    Body parameter

    {
  "text": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body MatchKeywordIntentRequest true The PUT request, consisting of the Text to be matched

    Example responses

    {}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    » keyword intent KeywordIntent false A keyword intent
    »» type string true The type of the Keyword
    »» description string false A meaningful description of this keyword intent
    »» keywords [Keyword] false A list of all keywords for this type
    »»» Keyword Keyword false A keyword
    »»»» name string true The unique reference, for this Keyword entry
    »»»» priority integer true The priority of the Keyword
    »»»» pattern string true The regular expression pattern
    »»»» description string false A meaningful description of this keyword entry
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Message Sender

    getAllSenders

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/sender \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'

  'Accept':'application/json'

};

  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/sender',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/message/sender", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /message/sender

    Get all Senders

    Get all configured Sender definitions

    Role: ROLE_MESSAGE Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "id": "1123-1313-141-436",
      "channel": "SMS",
      "value": "MyCompany",
      "countryCode": "GBR",
      "component": "FRAUD_ALERT",
      "brand": "My Company"
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [Sender] false No description
    » Message Sender Address Sender false A 'from' address, for an outgoing message
    »» id string false The unique reference, for this Sender entry
    »» channel string false The message channel, that this Sender can be used for
    »» value string true The 'from' address value
    »» countryCode string false The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code, that this SenderId can be used for
    »» component string false The component, that this Sender can be used for
    »» brand string false The client brand name

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    channel SMS
    channel EMAIL
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    addASender

    Code samples

  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  "id": "string",

  "value": "string",
  "countryCode": "str",
  "component": "string",
  "brand": "string"
}

    body body Sender true The new Sender configuration

  "value": {

    "channel": "SMS",
    "value": "MyCompany",
    "countryCode": "GBR",
    "component": "FRAUD_ALERT",
    "brand": "My Company"
  }
}

    req.Header = headers

    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...

    DELETE /message/sender/{senderId}

  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.get 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.get('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /user/group

    List all user groups

    Retrieve a list of all the user groups

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: READ

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "name": "string",
    "roles": [
      {
        "role": {
          "alias": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "description": "string",
          "enabled": true
        },
        "permissions": [
          {
            "name": "READ",
            "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [UserGroup] false No description
    » User Group UserGroup false A user group
    »» name string true Name of the UserGroup entry
    »» roles [UserRolePermission] false A list of all actions for the user group
    »»» User Role Permission UserRolePermission false A user role permission
    »»»» role Role true A user role
    »»»»» alias string false A display-friendly name, for this role
    »»»»» name string true The unique reference, for this role entry
    »»»»» description string false A meaningful description of this user group action
    »»»»» enabled boolean false Is this action enabled?
    »»»» permissions [Permission] false A list of all permissions associated to a role
    »»»»» Permission Permission false A user permission associated with a role
    »»»»»» name string true User role permission
    »»»»»» whenUpdated string(date-time) false When permission updated date (date-time - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    name READ
    name CREATE
    name UPDATE
    name DELETE
    name EXECUTE
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    createUserGroup

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /user/group

    Create a new user group

    Create a new user group

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body UserGroup true The POST request, consisting of the instance of the User Group Details

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getUserGroupByName

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /user/group/{userGroupName}

    Get the user group by name

    Retrieve the user group for a given name

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    userGroupName path string true The name of the user group

    Example responses

    {
  "name": "string",
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. UserGroup
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateUserGroup

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));

    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /user/group/{userGroupName}

    Update an existing user group.

    Update an existing user group

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    userGroupName path string true The name of the user group
    body body UserGroup true The PUT request, consisting of the instance of the User Group Body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteUserGroup

    Code samples

  }
})

    import requests

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName}', params={

)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/group/{userGroupName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /user/group/{userGroupName}

    Delete an user group definition

    Remove an user group

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    userGroupName path string true The name of the user group

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getUsers

    Code samples

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /user

    List all users

    Retrieve a list of all the users

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: READ

    Example responses

    {
  "value": [
    {
      "name": "PralhadH",
      "email": "pralhadh@telrock.com",
      "password": "",
      "accountLocked": false,
      "passwordLastUpdated": "2017-01-20 08:36:03",
      "requirePasswordChange": true,
      "lastLogin": "2017-06-20 08:36:03",
      "groups": [
        "admin",
        "test"
      ],
      "roles": [
        {
          "alias": "Reporting",
          "name": "ROLE_REPORTING",
          "description": "Feature enables reporting access",
          "roleLastUpdated": "2017-06-20 09:36:03",
          "permissions": {
            "create": true,
            "read": false
          }
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "MattD",
      "email": "mattd@telrock.com",
      "password": "",
      "accountLocked": false,
      "passwordLastUpdated": "2017-01-20 08:36:03",
      "requirePasswordChange": false,
      "lastLogin": "2017-06-20 08:36:03",
      "groups": [
        "admin"
      ],
      "roles": [
        {
          "alias": "Reporting",
          "name": "ROLE_REPORTING",
          "description": "Feature enables reporting access",
          "permissions": {
            "create": true,
            "read": false
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [User] false No description
    » User User false A user
    »» name string true The unique reference, for this User entry
    »» email string false Email Id of the user
    »» password string false Password of the user
    »» groups [string] false A list of all groups for the user
    »» roles [UserRolePermission] false A list of all actions for the user group
    »»» User Role Permission UserRolePermission false A user role permission
    »»»» role Role true A user role
    »»»»» alias string false A display-friendly name, for this role
    »»»»» name string true The unique reference, for this role entry
    »»»»» description string false A meaningful description of this user group action
    »»»»» enabled boolean false Is this action enabled?
    »»»» permissions [Permission] false A list of all permissions associated to a role
    »»»»» Permission Permission false A user permission associated with a role
    »»»»»» name string true User role permission
    »»»»»» whenUpdated string(date-time) false When permission updated date (date-time - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »»»»» accountLocked boolean false Is user account locked?
    »»»»» passwordLastUpdated string(date-time) false User last password updated date (date-time - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    »»»»» requirePasswordChange boolean false Is password change required?
    »»»»» lastLogin string(date-time) false User last login date (date-time - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    name READ
    name CREATE
    name UPDATE
    name DELETE
    name EXECUTE
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    createUser

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "password": "string",
  "groups": [
    "string"
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "accountLocked": true,
  "passwordLastUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "requirePasswordChange": true,
  "lastLogin": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.post 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /user

    Create a new user

    Create a new user

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "password": "string",
  "groups": [
    "string"
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "accountLocked": true,
  "passwordLastUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "requirePasswordChange": true,
  "lastLogin": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body User true The POST request, consisting of the instance of the User

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Resource created successfully. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getUserByName

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com

Accept: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}',
  method: 'get',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

const headers = {
  'Accept':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}',
{
  method: 'GET',

  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'

  'Accept' => 'application/json'
}

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)

  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

}, headers = headers)

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("GET");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /user/{userName}

    Get the user by name

    Retrieve the user for a given name

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    userName path string true The name of the user

    Example responses

    {
  "value": {
    "name": "MattD",
    "email": "mattd@telrock.com",
    "password": "",
    "accountLocked": false,
    "passwordLastUpdated": "2017-01-20 08:36:03",
    "requirePasswordChange": false,
    "lastLogin": "2017-06-20 08:36:03",
    "groups": [
      "admin"
    ],
    "roles": [
      {
        "alias": "Reporting",
        "name": "ROLE_REPORTING",
        "description": "Feature enables reporting access",
        "permissions": {
          "create": true,
          "read": false
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateUser

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "password": "string",
  "groups": [
    "string"
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "accountLocked": true,
  "passwordLastUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "requirePasswordChange": true,
  "lastLogin": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.put 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /user/{userName}

    Update an existing user

    Update an existing user

    Role: ROLE_AUTHENTICATIONS_ADMIN Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "password": "string",
  "groups": [
    "string"
  ],
  "roles": [
    {
      "role": {
        "alias": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "enabled": true
      },
      "permissions": [
        {
          "name": "READ",
          "whenUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "accountLocked": true,
  "passwordLastUpdated": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "requirePasswordChange": true,
  "lastLogin": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    userName path string true The name of the user
    body body User true The PUT request, consisting of the instance of the User Body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteUser

    Code samples

  }

    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/user/{userName}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /consent/unsubscribedcontact

    List all the recipients in unsubscribed contacts

    Retrieve a list of all the recipients in unsubscribed contacts

    Role: ROLE_STOP_LIST
    Permission: READ

    Example responses

    [
  {
    "id": "string",
    "recipient": "string",
    "channelType": "string",
    "component": "string",
    "alertType": "string",
    "reason": "string",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous [UnsubscribedContact] false No description
    » Unsubscribed Contact UnsubscribedContact false This is a record of a recipient requesting that their contact address be non-usable, by the platform.
    »» id string false The primary key
    »» recipient string true The recipient's contact address to unsubscribe
    »» channelType string true The delivery channel, that this contact recipient uses
    »» component string true The platform component, being unsubscribed from
    »» alertType string false The specific alert, being unsubscribed from
    »» reason string true The reason for unsubscribing
    »» whenLogged string(date-time) false The date this recipient was added
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    unsubscribeRecipient

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})

  "id": "string",
  "recipient": "string",
  "channelType": "string",

    req.Header = headers

    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /consent/unsubscribedcontact

    Add a recipient to the unsubscribed contact list

    Add a recipient to the unsubscribed contact list

    Role: ROLE_STOP_LIST
    Permission: CREATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "recipient": "string",
  "channelType": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "alertType": "string",
  "reason": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body UnsubscribedContact true The POST request, consisting of the instance of the unsubscribe contact Body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    getUnsubscribedContactByRecipient

    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Accept": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("GET", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    GET /consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}

    Get a specific unsubscribed contact from list

    Retrieve a specific unsubscribed contact from list

    Role: ROLE_STOP_LIST
    Permission: READ

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    id path string true The id of the recipient to retrieve

    Example responses

    {}

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. Inline
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Description
    » Unsubscribed Contact UnsubscribedContact false This is a record of a recipient requesting that their contact address be non-usable, by the platform.
    »» id string false The primary key
    »» recipient string true The recipient's contact address to unsubscribe
    »» channelType string true The delivery channel, that this contact recipient uses
    »» component string true The platform component, being unsubscribed from
    »» alertType string false The specific alert, being unsubscribed from
    »» reason string true The reason for unsubscribing
    »» whenLogged string(date-time) false The date this recipient was added
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    updateUnsubscribedContact

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    PUT https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}',
  method: 'put',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "id": "string",
  "recipient": "string",
  "channelType": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "alertType": "string",
  "reason": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}',
{
  method: 'PUT',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

headers = {
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
}

result = RestClient.put 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}',
  params: {
  }, headers: headers

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.put('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("PUT");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("PUT", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    PUT /consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}

    Update a specific unsubscribed contact from list

    Update an existing unsubscribed contact from list

    Role: ROLE_STOP_LIST
    Permission: UPDATE

    Body parameter

    {
  "id": "string",
  "recipient": "string",
  "channelType": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "alertType": "string",
  "reason": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    id path string true The id of the recipient to update
    body body UnsubscribedContact true The PUT request, consisting of the instance of the unsubscribed contact body

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    deleteUnsubscribedContact

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}


    DELETE https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id} HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com


    
$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}',
  method: 'delete',

  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}',
{
  method: 'DELETE'

})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});


    require 'rest-client'
require 'json'

result = RestClient.delete 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}',
  params: {
  }

p JSON.parse(result)


    import requests

r = requests.delete('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}', params={

)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("DELETE");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("DELETE", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    DELETE /consent/unsubscribedcontact/{id}

    Delete a specific unsubscribed contact from list

    Remove an existing unsubscribed contact from list

    Role: ROLE_STOP_LIST
    Permission: DELETE

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    id path string true The id of the recipient to delete

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    204 No Content Operation is successful with no expected response. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Simswap

    simSwapResult

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/simswap \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'


    POST https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/simswap HTTP/1.1
Host: your-instance.telrock.com
Content-Type: application/json


    var headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

$.ajax({
  url: 'https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/simswap',
  method: 'post',

  headers: headers,
  success: function(data) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(data));
  }
})


    const request = require('node-fetch');
const inputBody = '{
  "transaction_id": "string",
  "risk_result": "string",
  "account_id": "string",
  "campaign_id": "string",
  "msisdn": "string",
  "aspect_response_id": "string",
  "type_id": "string"
}';
const headers = {
  'Content-Type':'application/json'

};

fetch('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/simswap',
{
  method: 'POST',
  body: inputBody,
  headers: headers
})
.then(function(res) {
    return res.json();
}).then(function(body) {
    console.log(body);
});

  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'

  params: {
  }, headers: headers

  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

r = requests.post('https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/simswap', params={

}, headers = headers)

print r.json()


    URL obj = new URL("https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/simswap");
HttpURLConnection con = (HttpURLConnection) obj.openConnection();
con.setRequestMethod("POST");
int responseCode = con.getResponseCode();
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
    new InputStreamReader(con.getInputStream()));
String inputLine;
StringBuffer response = new StringBuffer();
while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
    response.append(inputLine);
}
in.close();
System.out.println(response.toString());


    package main

import (
       "bytes"
       "net/http"
)

func main() {

    headers := map[string][]string{
        "Content-Type": []string{"application/json"},

    }

    data := bytes.NewBuffer([]byte{jsonReq})
    req, err := http.NewRequest("POST", "https://your-instance.telrock.com/rest/v1/simswap", data)
    req.Header = headers

    client := &http.Client{}
    resp, err := client.Do(req)
    // ...
}

    POST /simswap

    Receive SimSwap Result

    Receive the results of a SimSwap request

    Body parameter

    {
  "transaction_id": "string",
  "risk_result": "string",
  "account_id": "string",
  "campaign_id": "string",
  "msisdn": "string",
  "aspect_response_id": "string",
  "type_id": "string"
}

    Parameters

    Parameter In Type Required Description
    body body SimSwapResult true The POST request, consisting of the SimSwap result details

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK Operation is successful. None
    400 Bad Request Validation failed. None
    401 Unauthorized The user does not have permission to invoke this resource/method. None
    404 Not Found Resource does not exist for the given id. None
    500 Internal Server Error An internal error occurred, while processing this request. None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: basic

    Schemas

    StartCampaignRequest

    {
  "startDate": "2018-04-05",
  "campaign": "string",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  },
  "plan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    startDate string(date) true The day-0 date, for the campaign instance (full-date - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    campaign string true The name of the campaign instance to start. This can be either the campaign name or id.
    attributes Attributes false No description
    placement Placement true No description
    plan PaymentPlan false No description

    StartCampaignResponse

    {
  "description": "string",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    description string false The failure details (if any) for the campaign request.
    attributes Attributes false No description

    StartSinglePaymentRequest

    {
  "singlePayment": {
    "id": "string",
    "reference": "string",
    "wallet": "string",
    "amount": 0,
    "currency": "string",
    "ruleName": "string",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "whenComplete": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "status": "WAITING",
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    }
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    singlePayment SinglePayment true No description
    placement Placement false No description

    StartPaymentPlanRequest

    {
  "replace": true,
  "paymentPlan": {
    "id": "string",
    "period": "WEEKLY",
    "total": 0,
    "ruleName": "string",
    "authType": "SMS",
    "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
    "wallets": [
      "string"
    ],
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "schedules": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  "placement": {
    "customer": {
      "id": "string",
      "title": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
      "contacts": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "address": "string",
          "consent": true,
          "hostSelectedChannel": true,
          "type": "MOBILE",
          "attributes": {
            "property1": "string",
            "property2": "string"
          }
        }
      ],
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "line1": "string",
          "line2": "string",
          "line3": "string",
          "city": "string",
          "county": "string",
          "postCode": "string",
          "country": "string"
        }
      ],
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    },
    "customerAccount": {
      "id": "string",
      "type": "string",
      "accountNumber": "string",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    replace boolean false Should this request replace an existing plan
    paymentPlan PaymentPlan true No description
    placement Placement false No description

    Placement

    {
  "customer": {
    "id": "string",
    "title": "string",
    "firstName": "string",
    "lastName": "string",
    "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
    "contacts": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "address": "string",
        "consent": true,
        "hostSelectedChannel": true,
        "type": "MOBILE",
        "attributes": {
          "property1": "string",
          "property2": "string"
        }
      }
    ],
    "addresses": [
      {
        "id": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "line1": "string",
        "line2": "string",
        "line3": "string",
        "city": "string",
        "county": "string",
        "postCode": "string",
        "country": "string"
      }
    ],

    }
  },
  "customerAccount": {
    "id": "string",
    "type": "string",
    "accountNumber": "string",
    "attributes": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    }
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    customer Customer true No description
    customerAccount CustomerAccount true No description

    Customer

    {
  "id": "string",
  "title": "string",
  "firstName": "string",
  "lastName": "string",
  "dateOfBirth": "2018-04-05",
  "contacts": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "address": "string",
      "consent": true,
      "hostSelectedChannel": true,
      "type": "MOBILE",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  ],
  "addresses": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "line1": "string",
      "line2": "string",
      "line3": "string",
      "city": "string",
      "county": "string",
      "postCode": "string",
      "country": "string"
    }
  ],
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string true The hostReference value
    title string false The customers title
    firstName string false The customers forename
    lastName string false The customers surname
    dateOfBirth string(date) false The customers DOB (full-date - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    contacts [CustomerContact] false No description
    addresses [CustomerAddress] false No description
    attributes Attributes false No description

    CustomerAddress

    {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "line1": "string",
  "line2": "string",
  "line3": "string",
  "city": "string",
  "county": "string",
  "postCode": "string",
  "country": "string"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string true The hostReference value
    name string true A reference name, meaningful to the customer
    line1 string false The 1st line of the address
    line2 string false The 2nd line of the address
    line3 string false The 3rd line of the address
    city string false The address city
    county string false The address county
    postCode string true The address post/zip code
    country string false The address country

    CustomerContact

    {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "address": "string",
  "consent": true,
  "hostSelectedChannel": true,
  "type": "MOBILE",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string true The primary key
    name string false A reference label, for this address
    address string true The digital contact address (i.e. MSISDN, Email address, etc)
    consent boolean false Has the customer consented to receive messages, via this address
    hostSelectedChannel boolean false The host-system can indicate 1 'preferred' contact address, for each channel type
    type string true The type of contact channel
    attributes Attributes false No description

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    type MOBILE
    type LANDLINE
    type EMAIL
    type FAX
    type OTHER

    CustomerAccount

    {
  "id": "string",
  "type": "string",
  "accountNumber": "string",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string true The primary key
    type string true The type of account (i.e. Loan, Card, Mortgage)
    accountNumber string true The account number
    attributes Attributes false No description

    Attributes

    {
  "property1": "string",
  "property2": "string"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    additionalProperties string false No description

    Brand

    {
  "name": "string",
  "defaultBrand": true,
  "country": "string",
  "alias": [
    "string"
  ]
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    name string true The brand name
    defaultBrand boolean false Is this the system-default brand
    country string false The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 or alpha-3 country-code
    alias [string] false A list of all alias, for this brand

    Language

    {
  "code": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "default": true
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    code string true The Language Code
    name string true The label of the language
    default boolean false Is this the default language

    SinglePayment

    {
  "id": "string",
  "reference": "string",
  "wallet": "string",
  "amount": 0,
  "currency": "string",
  "ruleName": "string",
  "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "whenComplete": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "status": "WAITING",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string false A unique reference, for this payment request. If not supplied then a random value will be generated.
    reference string false The payment authorisation reference (for externally processed payments)
    wallet string true The customer's payment source id
    amount number(double) true The payment value
    currency string true The payment currency code (ISO 4217)
    ruleName string false The business-rules package to use when performing validation for this payment request. If not supplied then only the basic data-integrity checks will be performed
    whenLogged string(date-time) false The date-time this payment was created (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    whenComplete string(date-time) false The date-time this payment finished processing (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    status string false The status of this payment
    attributes Attributes false No description

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    status WAITING
    status AUTHORISED
    status OBSOLETE
    status CANCELLED
    status DECLINED
    status EXPIRED
    status EXTERNAL
    status UNKNOWN
    status FAILED

    PaymentPlan

    {
  "id": "string",
  "period": "WEEKLY",
  "total": 0,
  "ruleName": "string",
  "authType": "SMS",
  "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "wallets": [
    "string"
  ],
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  },
  "schedules": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "amount": 0,
      "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
      "attributes": {
        "property1": "string",
        "property2": "string"
      }
    }
  ]
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string true hostReference value
    period string false The frequency of each payment schedule
    total number(double) true The total repayment amount
    ruleName string false The business-rules package to use when performing validation for this payment request. Basic product values are; "Payment Plan â€“ Auto Authorized" "Payment Plan â€“ Auto Authorized Testing â€“ Zero" "Payment Plan â€“ Auto Authorized Testing â€“ NonZero" "Payment Plan â€“ Auto Authorized Testing â€“ Immediate" "Single PTP" "Single PTP â€“ Zero" "Single PTP â€“ NonZero" "Single PTP â€“ Immediate" When the product config setting 'payment.plan.validation' is set to true, this value is used to identify the rules package, used to evaluate the submitted payment plan.
    authType string true The strategy for processing each PaymentSchedule
    whenLogged string(date-time) false The date, this plan was created (date-time - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    wallets [string] true All customer payment sources (by id), available for this payment plan
    attributes Attributes false No description
    schedules [PaymentSchedule] false No description

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    period WEEKLY
    period BIWEEKLY
    period MONTHLY
    period QUARTERLY
    period CUSTOM
    authType SMS
    authType AUTO

    PaymentSchedule

    {
  "id": "string",
  "amount": 0,
  "dueDate": "2018-04-05",
  "attributes": {
    "property1": "string",
    "property2": "string"
  }
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string true hostReference value
    amount number(double) true The scheduled payment amount
    dueDate string(date) true The date, of the scheduled payment (full-date - http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    attributes Attributes false No description

    MessageTemplate

    {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "component": "string",
  "brand": "string",
  "channel": "string",
  "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z",
  "messages": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "status": "string",
      "subject": "string",
      "message": "string",
      "plugin_body": "string",
      "language": "string",
      "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
    }
  ]
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string false host reference value
    name string true The template name
    component string true The template component name
    brand string true The brand Name
    channel string true The type of the message either SMS/EMAIL
    whenLogged string(date-time) false The Creation date and time of the template (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)
    messages [MessageTemplateBody] false A list of all message template bodies, for this message template

    MessageTemplateBody

    {
  "id": "string",
  "status": "string",
  "subject": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "plugin_body": "string",
  "language": "string",
  "whenLogged": "2018-04-05T02:49:35Z"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string false host reference value
    status string true The status of the template DRAFT/ACTIVE/DELETED
    subject string false The subject of the message
    message string true The body of the message
    plugin_body string true The plugin information for the message required by frontend to render the message
    language string true The language code/name
    whenLogged string(date-time) false The Creation date and time of the template body (date-time, http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)

    Formatter

    {
  "name": "string",
  "alias": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "maxLength": 0,
  "exampleValue": "string",
  "converterType": "string",
  "customFormat": "string",
  "customName": true
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    name string true The unique name of the formatter
    alias string false A user-defined name for this formatter
    description string false An explanation of the meaning, of this formatter
    maxLength integer true Max length for formatted value
    exampleValue string true Example value for this formatter
    converterType string true Convertor type (i.e. Default, number, date, datetime)
    customFormat string false Pattern for value formatting
    customName boolean false Flag to indicate custom name ( 0-no, 1-yes)

    MessageRequest

    {
  "channel": "SMS",
  "subject": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "recipient": "string"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    channel string true type of the message SMS / EMAIL
    subject string false subject of the message
    message string true content of the message
    recipient string true mobile number / email id

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    channel SMS
    channel EMAIL

    DynamicTags

    {
  "name": "string",
  "label": "string"

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    name string false The name of the dynamic tag
    label string false The description of the dynamic tag

    ReferenceComponent

    {
  "name": "string"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    name string false The name of reference component

    Queue

    {
  "name": "string",
  "alias": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "priority": 0,
  "type": "string",
  "direction": "ONE_WAY",
  "expires": 0,
  "defaultQueue": true
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    name string true A host-system queue definition that can be used to filter event-actions
    alias string false An alias provided by user
    description string false A meaningful description for this queue definition
    priority integer false Queue priority ranking (used for determining whether to replace an already running fraud-case)
    type string false The type of transactions that occur on this queue
    direction string false Does this queue handle 1-way or 2-way cases
    expires integer false The number of minutes, to wait for a customer response, for this queue
    defaultQueue boolean false Is this the default queue (If no specific queue is specified, in the incoming case)?

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    direction ONE_WAY
    direction TWO_WAY

    EventName

    {
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    name string true The event key/name
    description string false An explanation of the meaning, of this event

    Event

    {
  "event": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "rules": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "filters": [
        {
          "type": "string",
          "value": "string"
        }
      ],
      "actions": [
        {
          "actionType": "string"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    event string true The event, being returned
    description string false A meaningful description, for this action
    rules [EventRule] true A list of all event rules, for this event

    EventRule

    {
  "id": "string",
  "filters": [
    {
      "type": "string",
      "value": "string"
    }
  ],
  "actions": [
    {
      "actionType": "string"
    }
  ]
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    id string false The reference id
    filters [EventFilter] false Filters for this event
    actions [EventAction] false Actions event

    EventFilter

    {
  "type": "string",
  "value": "string"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    type string false Type of filter
    value string false Value of filter

    EventAction

    {
  "actionType": "string"
}

    Properties

    Name Type Required Description
    actionType string true Name of the action type

    EventCodeAction

    {
  "actionType": "string",
  "value": "string"
}

    Properties

    allOf - discriminator: EventAction.actionType

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous EventAction false No description

    and

    Name Type Required Description
    anonymous object false No description
    » value string true Value of code

  "actionType": "string",
  "value": "string"

    Properties
